climbs.name: Wisdom A.K.A. The Best Boulder Problem In Evergreen
climbs.fa: probably Noel Childs in the early '80s?

content.description: Start under the most obvious, crack system splitting the huge walls in half.  Get two hands almost on a matched crimp type hold and work the crack up to the (HB) crux.  From here you must get set up for a right hand toss into a nice in cut flake.  Keep you head about you and hand jam and face climb onto the tall slab above.  Top out the slab and walk around left.
content.location: From the 1st parking lot, follow the Sisters trail until it meets the Ponderosa.  head left (west) for about 50 yards.  You will see the massive wall about 100 yards up slope to the north.  Bushwhack your way up the main, south-facing, yellow-looking wall.

content.description:
Start is the same as for "

Auxiliary Verb

", but instead of moving up into the scoop in the corner/arete continue climbing left on small crimps and side pulls along the lip of the left leaning arete.  Top-out on the slab above.
content.protection: Pads and spotters.  The landing is good and flat but the hardest moves are insecure and fairly high off the deck!!
content.location: Located on the "Wisdom Wall."  Which is found on "The Brothers Lookout" 1st Tier lower right (EAST) side.

content.description:
This line starts with a (SDS) on the farthest right hand side of the main south wall. It then traverses diagonally left past intestine power moves that really test one's finger strength. After about 15 to 20 feet of climbing right, you converge with "

The Best Boulder Problem In Evergreen

." You link the two section all the way to the summit. This is pumpy and testy!!! Walk off right.

It may be the hardest line at Three Sisters! If you want something that can offer you the full value V9, look no farther! Send it!
content.location: From the 1st parking lot follow the Sisters trail until it meets the Ponderosa.  head left (west) for about 50 yards.  You will see the massive wall about 100 yards up slope to the north.  Bush whack your way up the main south facing yellow looking wall.

content.description:
Climb the tall steep scary face just left of "

Wisdom

" and just right of "The face/crack project."  I have tried this one a little with no luck!!!  Not even a little!!!  It has seen some attempts but as far as I know, no success to date.

There is still a good deal of lose stone left to pull off this line but the solid crimp systems that will one day lead one to the finish is quite visible and looks as if it will go.  I feel this one has been a long time in it's development because of the difficulty of cleaning this steep high ball combined with the proposed difficulty of a possible V12+!!!!  If it can be cleaned by rope the odds of this line getting done will be much improved.

When completed this will be the high ball jewel of Three Sisters Park.  Like always if anyone has sent this line to date please let me know so I can update the information.  Thanks and good luck!!
content.protection: As many pads and spotters as you can get!!!
content.location:
Located on "The Wisdom Wall."  Climb the steep face just left of "

Wisdom

" and to the right of the "Crack/Face project."  The photo beta I am posting should help those willing to try it a good sense of the line.  When you stand beneath this project.... it will be clear what you must do!!!

content.description:
Start with either a gaston with your (L) or crimp the obvious face hold with your (R)? Power up and into a small sharp crimp with you (L) and then chose your foot position carefully while gaining just the right leverage to make the long, powerful and committing move to a far away crimp located up and to the right. Quickly gain a nice left hand flake, and work your way on top of a small ledge system caped by a left-leaning crack and a bulge.

To finish, climb up and left into a shallow scoop. Continue up and left via the easiest way onto the slab above.

Nice work, Jason. Impressive send!
content.protection: A few pads and a least one spotter.
content.location: Located on the left side of "The Wisdom Wall" just before you head hard up slop and into a bunch of bushes and trees.  Referring to the photo beta would be best.

content.description: Start in the same crimp system as for "The Razor."  Climb out diagonally up and right via crimps,under-clings and bad slopers until you reach the upper jug/flake system that lead's to the top-out.  Finish on the upper slabs above.  This turned out to be a really nice  nice line!!  It's high ball climbing but the hardest moves are concentrated within the 1st ten or so feet of climbing making it long, hard and airy but surprisingly safe for a difficult high ball problem.  It may only be as hard as V8-V9 but so worth the time and effort!!!

This is a potential FA starting at

Rock Cheetah

and climbing across into and up

Wisdom

. It felt about V9. I spoke with a few locals, and no one had knowledge of a previous send. Someone just let me know, and I will change, otherwise I am claiming it!
content.location:
Start the same as

Rock Cheetah

, but after doing the first two moves and getting matched on the crimp rail, walk your feet right, and do a hard bump to a sidepull just to the left of the huge jug flake on

Wisdom

. Walk your feet over again, and bump to the jug flake. This climbs really well.

content.description:
Start on the far right side of "The Wisdom Wall" above the lower start of "Undercover Brother."  Climb the corner/arete on a nice rail system then get a heel hook right and crank up into a nice horizontal crack/seam system (CRUX) that leads to a scary insecure scoop.  Rest up in the scoop and then gather your brain cells and move with care the top of the formation.  Walk off right and climb back down a small gully to get back to your gear.

This has been a HIGHLY OVER LOOKED LINE on "The Wisdom Wall."  It's so good and the line is supper tall but the landing is good.  THIS LINE SHOULD NOT BE MISSED!!!!!!!
content.protection: Pads and a few spotters would be best as that is the general rule of thumb to climb safely at "The Wisdom Wall."
content.location: Located on the lower, South-facing tier of "The Brothers Lookout."  It's on the far right corner arete of "The Wisdom Wall."

content.description:
Start on the first half of "

Wisdom

." Climb until you get to the crystal that you use to toss out right to the flakes on

Wisdom

." Look left, and you will see a nice, horizontal crack/seam. Crimp like mad as you traverse left into the middle of the project left of "

Wisdom

." Finish the middle and upper section of this project.

This is not as hard as the direct version, but it's still going to be a classic when it goes... and it won't be long!!!
content.protection: Many, many pads and at least two spotters!!!  Big fall potential!!!
content.location: From the 1st parking lot, take the Sisters trail until it meets up with the Ponderosa. Take a left (west) for about 50 yards, look up to your right, and you will see this tall, steep wall called the "Wisdom Wall" about 100 or so yards uphill. Once you have got it spotted, just keep your eye on it as you continue to bushwhack your way up to the steep tall madness of the "Wisdom Wall."
